title: 1 dead, 4 injured after shooting on Expressway, police say
content:
EGG HARBOR TWP. -- One person was killed and four others were wounded in a shooting that began on the Atlantic City Expressway and ended with victims on the Garden State Parkway and in a Wawa parking lot, according to New Jersey State Police.
New Jersey State Police were called for a shooting on the Expressway in the northbound lane at milepost 11 at 2:55 p.m. At 3:03 p.m., troopers received a call for medical assistance at northbound lane milepost 37 on the Garden State Parkway and in the Wawa parking lot.
Trooper Alejandro Goez said there are five people injured, including one person who was reported dead. Police were on scene at a Wawa near the Atlantic City Airport Monday afternoon where they were investigating a white SUV where some of the shooting victims ended up. Other troopers were investigating a car on the Garden State Parkway in the Egg Harbor Township area, Goez said.
The SUV in the Wawa parking lot had numerous bullet holes in the windshield and passenger side of the vehicle, and blood could be seen inside the SUV. The rear passenger side tire on the SUV appeared to be blown out during the drive to the Wawa.
Victim update in shooting incident in Atlantic Co.: 5 total victims and 1 reported dead. NJSP and Egg Harbor Twp Pd. investigating.
-- NJSP - State Police (@NJSP) August 29, 2016
Investigations on the Expressway and Parkway caused traffic buildup into Monday evening.
New Jersey State Police and the Egg Harbor Township Police Department are both involved in the investigation.
